sentence.Network_en: We reached a beautiful grotto , whose entrance was almost hiden by the vine.
sentence.Network_cn: 我们到达了一个美丽的洞穴, 洞的进口几乎被藤蔓遮掩著.

sentence.Network_en: Water trickles through an underground grotto.
The people of hope to visiting grotto come from Africa.
sentence.Network_cn: 希望参观岩洞的人们来自非洲.

PerfectNetExp.abs: 蓝洞（Grotto）———一种海底山脉的岩洞，在塞班最为著名的蓝洞是位于岛东北角的一个通过海底通道连接外部海洋的巨大的石灰岩 …

derivation.yuyuan_name: early 17th cent.: from Italian grotta, via Latin from Greek kruptē (see crypt)

entry.def: A grotto is a small cave with interesting or attractively shaped rocks.

example.ex: Water trickles through an underground grotto.

means.word_mean: 1. a small cave (usually with attractive features)
